abstract: State Dept formally designates Afghan branch of Islamic State terrorist organization, extending government's range of options for fighting group, which is primarily made up of former Taliban members.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Labels Afghan Cell of ISIS a Global Terrorist Organization
headline.main: U.S. Lists Afghan Branch of ISIS as Terrorist Group

keywords.value: Sinai Province of the Islamic State
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The State Department’s listing allows American military operations against the group to fall under the counterterrorism mission agreed to by the Afghan government.
lead_paragraph: The State Department’s listing allows American military operations against the group to fall under the counterterrorism mission agreed to by the Afghan government.
